bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Planter from Poplar Mount plantation near Ridgeway, Warren Co., N.C.; member, North Carolina House of Commons, 1814-1815; member, U.S. House of Representatives, 1815-1827; member, North Carolina Senate, 1833-1846, 1850-1854 (speaker, 1850-1854); supporter of John C. Calhoun and leader of the secession movement.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Scattered correspondence and papers of Edwards. Topics include his entrance into politics; his thoughts on Thomas Ruffin, North Carolina's role in the Civil War, Reconstruction, and the Democratic Party; and some legal documents with Robert Park, settling the estate of George W. Long in the 1820s.
